channel.title: Is this 126 cmb?
channel.description: public int getXPForLevel(int level) { int points = 0; int output = 0; for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= level; lvl++) { points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0)); if (lvl >= level) { return output; } output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4); } return 0; } public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { int points = 0; int output = 0; for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) { points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0)); output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) { return lvl; } } return 99; }

item.title: Is this 126 cmb?
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

No, it just tells the level number for a specific amount of XP, ie, 0 to 83 xp is level 1, and so on.

item.title: Is this 126 cmb?
item.dc:creator: @0uch_a_arr0w 0uch a arr0w
item.description:
@0uch_a_arr0w wrote:

public int getXPForLevel(int level) { int points = 0; int output = 0; 
  for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= level; lvl++) {
     points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
     if (lvl >= level) {
        return output;
     }
     output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
  }
  return 0;

}

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

  for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
     points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
     output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
     if (output >= exp) {
        return lvl;
     }
  }
  return 99;

}
